poem:
The Paradox of Knowing

In the laboratory's silent hum,  
memories distill in glass—  
a world reduced to signals,  
yet the heart resists.  

In fields of science, he whispers  
against the ironclad genes,  
for in the pulsing shadows  
lies the mystery of what it means.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Steven Rose obituary Science and politics can make awkward bedfellows, with the very question of whether it is possible to make purely objective observations about the world drawing forth highly politicised positions. The neurobiologist Steven Rose, who has died aged 87, took a broadly reductionist approach to his research into biochemical mechanisms of memory, while at the same time adopting a high-profile political stance against the idea that human behaviour is determined by our genes.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
